name: lssmre
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c1, cfv(cmre, c2)))

-| diffsc(hs0, c1)
-| diffsc(hs0, c2)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(c0, clmod))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ∈(Moore ` c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c1 ⊆ P(c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c2 ∈ c1)
⊣ ((c0 ∈ LMod ∧ hs0 ⊆ c1 ∧ hs0 ≠ ∅)→ ⋂ hs0 ∈ c1)
⊣ d(hs0, c1)
⊣ d(hs0, c2)
⊣ d(hs0, c0 ∈ LMod)

comment: The subspaces of a module comprise a Moore system on the vectors of the module. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)
